alert.note: Alert for Montrose (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 4:34PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, within west Montrose County. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may cause flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos could result in water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Roc Creek to the confluence with the Dolores River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Montrose County, including S 1/2 Road and the junction of Highway 141. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
